meanings.definition: Slightly smaller or shorter in stature or size.
meanings.sent1: The puppy was titchier than the adult dog.
meanings.sent2: The kitten was titchier than the cat.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse felt titchier than the big elephant.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as titchier as a delicate flower.
meanings.sent5: The little bird looked even titchier in the vast sky.

meanings.sent1: She had a titchier expression when waiting in line.
meanings.sent2: His titchier tone indicated his annoyance.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat had a titchier attitude than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her impatience was as titchier as a boiling kettle.
meanings.sent5: The child's frown grew even titchier as he waited.

meanings.definition: To make something smaller or more compact.
meanings.sent1: She tried to titchier the pile of clothes to fit in the drawer.
meanings.sent2: He titchiered the boxes to save space in the room.
meanings.sent3: The magician titchiered the rabbit to fit in his hat.
meanings.sent4: She titchiered her thoughts into a concise speech.
meanings.sent5: The artist titchiered the painting to fit in a small frame.
